name: Google Workspace (Gmail, Drive, Docs, Sheets, Calendar, Meet)
dataHosting: US default; EU on higher tiers
keyRisks: Data subject to US CLOUD Act. Extensive tracking feeds ad/AI models. Free tier eliminated for orgs. Data export possible but complex. EU hosting only on expensive plans.

name: Gmail (free/personal)
keyRisks: All email scanned for ads/AI. No data residency options. Not GDPR compliant for organisational use. Easy to leave but contacts/history lost.

name: Microsoft 365 (Outlook, OneDrive, Word, Excel, Teams, SharePoint)
keyRisks: UK hosting available but parent co. still US-jurisdicted. Deepest lock-in of any suite. Prices risen ~25% in 3 years. Copilot/AI trains on your data by default.

name: Microsoft Teams
keyRisks: Tightly bundled with M365 — near-impossible to use alternatives. Metadata extensively collected. Requires M365 licence.

name: Slack
keyRisks: Acquired by Salesforce 2021. Data in US. Free tier: 90-day history limit. Paid plans expensive for small orgs. Good data export.

name: Zoom
keyRisks: Updated ToS 2023 allowing AI training on calls. Data routed through US. Low lock-in. Prices increased.

name: WhatsApp (organisational use)
keyRisks: Metadata harvested even with E2E encryption. Owned by Meta. Not suitable for sensitive organisational comms. No group data export.

name: Dropbox
keyRisks: Data in US. Moderate tracking. Reasonable export. Easy to switch. Prices have increased.

name: Salesforce
keyRisks: Extremely deep lock-in. Proprietary data model. Very expensive. Migration is a major project. EU hosting available.

name: HubSpot
keyRisks: Data in US. Freemium hooks you in, prices escalate. Proprietary data model. Tracks website visitors extensively.

name: Canva
keyRisks: Data on US infrastructure. Teams prices increased 300% in 2024. AI features train on content. Templates/brand kits create dependency.

name: Mailchimp
keyRisks: Acquired by Intuit. Free tier severely cut. Data shared across Intuit products. Significant price increases since acquisition.

name: Trello
keyRisks: Owned by Atlassian. Data in US. Free tier limited. Low lock-in — easy to export and switch.

name: Monday.com
keyRisks: Data in US. Expensive per-seat pricing. Moderate lock-in through workflows. Tracks usage for AI.

name: Asana
keyRisks: Data in US. Per-seat pricing. Moderate lock-in. AI features in development. Good data export. Increasingly expensive.

name: WordPress.com (hosted)
keyRisks: Hosted version is US-based. Self-hosted WordPress.org is open source and excellent. Lock-in through proprietary themes/plugins.

name: Squarespace
keyRisks: Data in US. Proprietary — cannot take your site elsewhere. Poor data export. Annual pricing creates lock-in.

name: Wix
keyRisks: Data in US. Highest lock-in of any CMS — virtually impossible to migrate. Aggressive upselling.

name: SurveyMonkey
keyRisks: Data in US. Expensive. Low lock-in (data exportable). Tracks respondent behaviour. Significant price increases.

name: Typeform
keyRisks: Spanish company but US cloud. GDPR compliant. Low lock-in. Expensive per-response pricing.

name: Google Forms
keyRisks: All responses feed Google's data ecosystem. Free but data is harvested. Tied to Google Sheets.

name: Meta (Facebook / Instagram)
keyRisks: Maximum surveillance. Data harvested for ads. Algorithmic control over reach. Community locked in platform.

name: X / Twitter
keyRisks: Under Musk: unpredictable policy changes, API restricted, staff gutted. High continuity risk. Maximum surveillance.

name: LinkedIn
keyRisks: Microsoft-owned. Extensive professional data harvesting. AI training on posts/messages. Network lock-in.

name: Calendly
keyRisks: Data in US. Calendar access is sensitive. Low lock-in. Easy to replace.

name: Eventbrite
keyRisks: Data in US. Attendee data harvested. Transaction fees. Moderate lock-in through event history.

name: Amazon Web Services
keyRisks: UK hosting available but Amazon is US-jurisdicted. Deep lock-in through proprietary services. CLOUD Act applies.
